summary: The Healthy Dog Importation Act aims to amend the Animal Health Protection Act regarding the importation of live dogs into the United States.  It establishes new requirements for importers, including providing electronic documentation of good health, vaccinations, and identification. It also defines terms like "compensation," "importer," and "import transporter." The bill covers exceptions, mandates regulatory implementation within 18 months, and details enforcement and penalties for non-compliance.  It also includes a transition period and a conforming amendment.
